reviews.review_msg: It would be useful to take this course from someone who has more experience working in the health system, but Tarya does a fairly good job with explaining things clearly. Readings are essential, but this is (in my opinion) an extremely important course for HSCI undergrads to take, so it is worth the effort.

This class has a lot of readings! Personally, I found the material to be boring and dry; has nothing to do with her as a prof. She's a good instructor. Just be prepared to put a lot of work into this class, if you want to do well. It's not an "easy A" type of class.
Great prof!! Keep up with your readings and you will be fine. Tests are very fair. She's there to help students.
Great prof. Really understands the students and tries to really help. Exams are fair and marking is fair for the most part.
